name: Serious Sandwiches: Whatta Tuna Sandwich!
description: Posted to the Serious Sandwiches Flickr Photo Group by Dylan Valliere Normally, I like to leave the serious sandwich making to the professionals, and typically this column focuses on already prepared sandwiches available in some sort of complete and...
recipeIngredient: 2 (6 ounce) cans Italian tuna in extra-virgin olive oil or water, well drained
1 (14 ounce) can artichoke hearts in water, drained and chopped
1/2 cup pitted Calamata black olives, chopped
1/2 cup soft sun-dried tomatoes, thinly sliced
2 small celery ribs with greens attached from the heart of the bunch, chopped
2 roasted red peppers, drained and chopped
1/2 cup fresh basil leaves, torn or chopped
Coarse salt and freshly ground pepper
1 loaf crusty Italian bread, split lengthwise and hollowed out

recipeInstructions.text: In a shallow bowl, flake the tuna. Add the artichoke hearts, olives, sun-dried tomatoes, onion, garlic, celery, hot peppers, parsley, basil, lemon zest and juice and combine. Dress the salad with extra-virgin olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Stuff the salad into the hollowed-out crusty bread and serve.
